61// Macro definitions

63//*****************************************************************************
64#define IPC_MBOX_FIFO_MAX_DEPTH (32)
65#define IPC_MBOX_MAX_THRESHOLD (IPC_MBOX_FIFO_MAX_DEPTH - 1)
66#define IPC_MBOX_MIN_THRESHOLD (1)
67#define IPC_MBOX_DEFAULT_THRESHOLD (1)
68
69#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_IN_EMPTY _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_D2MEMPTY, CM55IPC->STATUS)
70#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_IN_FULL _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_D2MFULL, CM55IPC->STATUS)
71#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_IN_THACTIVE _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_D2MTHRESHOLDACTIVE, CM55IPC->STATUS)
72#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_IN_PEND _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_D2MPEND, CM55IPC->STATUS)
73#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_OUT_EMPTY _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_M2DEMPTY, CM55IPC->STATUS)
74#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_OUT_FULL _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_M2DFULL, CM55IPC->STATUS)
75#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_OUT_THACTIVE _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_M2DTHRESHOLDACTIVE, CM55IPC->STATUS)
76#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_STATUS_OUT_PEND _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_STATUS_M2DPEND, CM55IPC->STATUS)
77#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_ERROR_D2MEMPTY _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_D2MERROR_D2MEMPTYERROR, CM55IPC->D2MERROR)
78#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_ERROR_D2MFULL _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_D2MERROR_D2MFULLERROR, CM55IPC->D2MERROR)
79#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_ERROR_M2DFULL _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_D2MERROR_M2DFULLERROR, CM55IPC->D2MERROR)
80#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_ERROR_IPCINIT _FLD2VAL(CM55IPC_D2MERROR_IPCINIT, CM55IPC->D2MERROR)
81#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_WR_DATA(data) (CM55IPC->M2DDATA = (data))
82#define AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_RD_DATA(data) ((data) = CM55IPC->D2MDATA)
83//*****************************************************************************
84//
85// Global definitions
86//
87//*****************************************************************************
88enum
89{
90 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_START = 0xA868,
91 //
92 // The M2D and D2M are only used for IPC TX/RX packets interrupt notification
93 // which involves the IPC service.
94 //
95 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_M2D = AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_START,
96 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_D2M,
97
98 //
99 // There is some specific scenario to use mailbox for signalling and the IPC
100 // serivce will not be involved.
101 //
102
103 //
104 // The application core may request the RFXTAL clock from the network processing
105 // core. In general it should write the request magic number to the mailbox FIFO
106 // and register a handler (which will be serviced in ISR) to the response magic
107 // number and wait for the success response from network core. A timeout should
108 // be implemented for the request in case there is error on network core.
109 // The network core should service this clock request prior to general IPC service
110 // data even the data has been queued.
111 //
112 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_RFXTAL_ON_REQ,
113 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_RFXTAL_ON_RSP,
114 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_RFXTAL_OFF_REQ,
115 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_RFXTAL_OFF_RSP,
116 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_RFXTAL_CONFIG_REQ,
117 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_RFXTAL_CONFIG_RSP,
118 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_IPC_SHM_CONFIG_REQ,
119 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_IPC_SHM_CONFIG_RSP,
120
121 AM_HAL_IPC_MBOX_SIGNAL_MSG_END
122};
123

151} am_hal_ipc_mbox_init_state_e;
